summary: This bill, the Fort Ontario Holocaust Refugee Shelter National Historical Park Establishment Act, aims to establish the Fort Ontario National Monument in New York as a National Historical Park. It outlines the purpose of the park as preserving resources related to the 982 World War II refugees housed there. The bill defines key terms, specifies the establishment process, including conditions for the Secretary of the Interior's determination of a manageable park unit, and outlines administration and land acquisition procedures, including cooperative agreements and a management plan.
